question.text: The ___ of the sales and marketing departments into two separate teams wili allow for better management of our resources.

answer.explanation: Division of st into st = Dividing/Separating st into smaller parts

question.text: After all resumes have been reviewed, selected candidates will be ___ for interviews.

answer.explanation:
Invite sb for st
Signal to sb for st

question.text: When you need supplies, ___a request with the office manager.

answer.explanation: (D) File has the same meaning here as “submit”. Choice (A) is a form of the verb fill Choices (B) and (C) are forms of the verb “fall”.

question.text: The finance committee will meet again ___ the eighth of May.

answer.explanation: (D) A specific date requires “on”. Choice (A) indicates purpose. Choice (B) indicates destination. Choice (C) indicates source.
(B) Use “on” with days of the week. Choice (A) means “inside”. Choice (C) means “above”. Choice (D) indicates location.

question.text: They will interview each candidate before they___who to hire.

answer.explanation: (A) The present tense form of the verb is used in a future time clause. Choice (B) is present continuous. Choice (C) is future. Choice (D) is simple past.

question.text: All cabin attendants must lock the cabindoor___leaving the room.

answer.explanation: (B) “After” establishes a logical time relationship between the two events. Choice (A) is an adverb, indicating a period of time after a specific event. Choice (C) indicates a comparison. (His fax arrived later than mine). Choice (D) is an adjective and cannot be used to join clauses.

question.text: ___your time card whenever you enter or leave the building.

answer.explanation: (A) This is an imperative verb, telling the listener what to do. Choice (B) is simple present tense. Choice (C) is simple past tense. Choice (D) is present participle.

question.text: Our contact information is printed on the back cover of the manual so that you may ___ refer to it.

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the verb "refer" so we use an adverb.

question.text: In ___ of the fine seasonal weather, Minnie’s Southern Kitchen will be opening its patio area for dining beginning on April 5.

answer.explanation: In consideration of st = Considering st = Thinking about st
